column6: This place has some of the best octopus and best drinks I've ever had. This was my first time coming to this spot and I'm so glad I finally stopped by. The waiter was very helpful in explaining the menu and making sure that my peanut allergy was known to the kitchen staff. We had the guac, charred octopus, Taco De tromps, and the Pork Tacos. Just know that everything comes pretty small so you've got to get a few different items to get full. The only reason why I can't give this place five stars is because I absolutely hated the dessert option. It was basically a fried churro type thing with cream but I felt the cream didn't have enough taste and that the fried crispy bits had no substance but that's just me! I'd love to see a few more dessert options for the dairy sensitive people. Other than that amazing, amazing restaurant with great ambience, really dim lighting, and wonderful food.

unexpected, excellent intimate atmosphere with large outdoor area. great cocktails and food, especially loved the yellowtail ceviche and the poached lobster. the duck breast was fantastic, particularly the stuffed heirloom corn dough. best tortillas i've had.

The thing I love most about living in Williamsburg is that when I think I've been to any restaurant worth visiting, I'm proven wrong on every occasion. My friend recommended Aldama when for lunch after we had spent the morning at Domino Park. I hadn't heard of the restaurant but my friend only had glowing things to say about it. We walked about 10 minutes from the park to the restaurant which is located in south Williamsburg. Aldama is a modern Mexican restaurant that's ideal for a special night out. The spot is on the smaller side with a large bar and table seating around that. When it came time to order we decided to get the guacamole as well as an assortment of canasta and trompo tacos which were amazing. We also had the house margarita which was equally exceptional. Come here if you find yourself in the area with a craving for quality Mexican dishes!

Mmmmm. Meh. The drinks here are a little better than cocktails you'll get at most spots, but they're still not worth the $18 a cocktail costs at this point. It's also kind of silly that the Happy Hour only applies to the bar, but I just think that concept is lame in general. The food was tasty but what small portions! Their take on a carne asada taco was delicious, but overall there's nothing here to ever bring me back, unless my lovely girlfriend wants me to.

The dining room is zen boho like, the food is like I am sitting in Mexico City, and the drinks are unique. Really loved the service here and the food while celebrating my birthday here. That said they have a strict max on how long you can sit at the table which blows when you are with a larger party

Very cute ambience, good music and nice service. The food thought is a bit disappointing. Chicken with mole was just sweet and lacked some freshness in all the dishes. Some vegetables would be great. The tacos were tasty but again fresh pineapples would be better than pineapple sauce.

This place is pretty unassuming when you first enter, you'd think this place was just a small bar with a few seats but when you get taken through to the seating area you'll see there is more indoor and outdoor seating. My friend made a reservation for Saturday at 5:30 and we were able to be seated right away. All the staff was very nice, we really liked the ambiance and the decor, one thing that was funny was the little water cup, now they did keep our cups filled but it was just enough to take a swallow of water before someone had to come back around and fill it up again. Now this menu is very unique and besides some things like guacamole this menu looked nothing like I'd ever seen in a Mexican restaurant, now that's not really a bad thing because the food was really good and of great quality, we got the guacamole which instead of being served with tortilla chips was served with 3 tortillas that were of the same consistency of a chip, no complaints it was great and had a little spice to it, you can tell they didn't over do it with salt and instead used herbs and spices, that's important to me. We got the duck appetizer which was unique and good, we also got the Taco De Trompo which also was good but really $9 for a taco? Now it was unique I have to give them that but really overpriced in my opinion, we shared the Asado which is a 26 oz steak, it's served with some cheese with fig we think and tortillas also with a green sauce, now the quality of this steak is great, well flavored but not overly seasoned and can easily be shared by 3-4 people, you definitely pay a lot for it but it's good, what I didn't like is when we finished the tortillas and were offered more we expected that it would be complimentary considering the amount we paid for it but I was disappointed later to see that we were charged for it, now in comparison to the price of the total bill it was small change but it's the principle in my mind, this is a unique place that is very pricey but it's also unlike any Mexican place I've been to before, the drinks are pricey as well, it's a good place to check out but for my budget I couldn't come here too often.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY

column6: Come for happy hour!! Drinks are around 10$ and there are food specials as well! Otherwise wasn't too pleased with my actual meal. We ordered gauc and chips- the avocado was not ripe so there were big hard pieces in my gauc. Then for a party of 5 they gave us 4 chips. I also don't like these new "chips" which were small whole corn tortillas (so then you just break it up yourself). Didn't make sense for a big bowl of gauc. The mezcal based frozen drink was delicious but it went from 10$ to 14/15$? Same size, that's ridiculous. Come for happy hour otherwise not sure if it's worth your time. Nothing else we ate was really worth mentioning.

Great new addition in the Williamsburg area. Stopped by here with a friend to check it out and had a great time! The guacamole was outstanding and the cocktails were fantastic and worth trying. The happy hour was worth checking out, the server Vivian was very hospitable!
Excellent food! Amazing drinks , don't miss happy hours  high recommend, nice music good vibes
Best tacos de trompo in nyc. Everything is super fresh and delicious. Definitely recommend

I came here yesterday for my friends birthday. I told the waiter that I had a peanut allergy, and he told me the only item we ordered that had peanuts was the guacamole. We ordered a variety of shared plates, including the cornish hen. I ended up having a horrible allergic reaction and had to go to the emergency room. We were supposed to go to a concert that evening that I spent 120 dollars on, but I instead could not go and spent 300 dollars on an emergency room visit. I am very disappointed in this service.

The food here is pretty good we had the lobster and chicken.  They drinks were good as well I had a Mt. Fuji similar to a Margarita.  Seating outdoor is nice however flies and mosquitos are a bit of a nuisance hence the reason for 4 stars.  Overall great vibe and ambience check it out!

This incredible meal is definitely one of the top restaurants in Williamsburg. Food highlights: Taco de Trompo, Hamachi and Tacos de canasta.  The setting and music were perfect and the staff was helpful and informative.

Aldama was truly an experience. The staff was more than generous and the food was delicious. They have devine vegan options and not to mention the guacamole and cocktails are to die for. Cannot wait to return again!

Let me start with the Daykon tostadas they were amazing and the service is tje best !   From beginning to end. Drinks are strong and delicious ! Great selection of mezcal, I love the decorations!  Special thanks to William for your hospitality. We did not have a reservation but he went out of his way to accommodate us!
Cozy place, great vibes, awesome staff, gourmet food. Willie was very accommodating to our needs and an excellent host.
What an INCREDIBLE meal! Wonderful cocktails, amazing food, excellent service. Prices are comparable to any nice New York/BK meal. Ambiance is great. Highly recommend!

This was probably the best Mexican food I have had outside of CDMX. We started with the tacos de canasta, yellowfin ceviche, and taco de trompo. All were phenomenal in their own ways, but the taco de trompo was probably the best taco I have had -- and this is from someone who adores tacos de trompo and al pastor tacos like no one I've ever met. Completely worth the price, was an experience that left me only wanting more, which in this case is a good thing. At the end I had to shake the chefs hands, because as many know, their creativity often goes unappreciated.
Sind at night was so welcoming!  Food and drinks is amazing bud service is wonderful. This is my favorite restaurant in Brooklyn. What a great experience. Thank you for a amazing dinner experience!

Top notch. I don't usually write reviews, but I can't begin to emphasize how good this meal was start to finish. Everyone who works here-A++++, the food-not just delicious, but filled with integrity, authenticity...the commitment to story.

thursday night with not reservation .. But they were very excited to have us. Mg and host were very welcoming!! food is amazing. octopus is a not missing plate. thanks for a great dining experience!!!
My new favorite gem !!!  Excellent service !!  Best chicken I'd ever had!!   Great selection of mezcal and the Asian hostess was nice and friendly. !!  I can't wait to come back for brunch

I absolutely love this place . I was there on Thursday with my boyfriend and we had a great time .  The food was awesome ,tasty  drinks and amazing service. I will be back to try their brunch . I definitely recommend this place . 5 stars from me and my bf. Keep it up the great work, Aldama

This place has a lot to be said in its favor: great staff, drinks, ambiance. However. Many vegans and vegetarians will come here for the vegan mole - which is a dish one basically never comes across, it's practically an oxymoron. This restaurant makes a big deal about this dish. It's the most expensive on the menu. And it is awful. Besides being almost nothing other than mole - a few tiny  mushrooms, that's it - the mole tastes burnt with a charcoal aftertaste. No one at my table found anything positive to say about it. And two of us found it repugnant enough to stop eating entirely. So disappointing!
Great ambience!!   Food is amazing!! Service is friendly and professional. Drinks :  try the sangre de mezcal !! Lo love the music !!

Underwhelming... Maybe since it was a soft opening ( I hope), I'll give them another shot in a couple of months.  I got duped by the nyeater article prior to visiting. "Despite his history serving drinks at top-tier restaurants, Reyes wants Aldama to be an approachable, everyday hangout. "I don't want to have a hundred different tequilas and mezcals on our wall," he says. Instead, the bar is focusing on 10 bottles of each, available for sipping from copitas with slices of oranges. A happy hour -- 5 to 7 p.m. daily -- advertises frozen margaritas and beer and mezcal shot combos for $10 or less.".....  There was no mezcal selection, only one cocktail list with 6 drinks ($14 each), one with mezcal....and it was frozen...I'd assume since the founder of the establishment is a bartender, the drinks would be more impressive...to each their own. Food menu was short as well and did not wow me either (and we ordered everything with the exception of the guacamole) There are only 2 meat options on the menu, both are small plates.  One is the cecina; thinly sliced, dried, crispy filet( think beef jerky meets chicharron) and the tacos- very good!  As explained by our server, the corn is imported de Mexico and milled in house! Growing pains... I'm sure they'll right the ship... Go here and you'll see what I'm talking about.

4 stars for the food but two and a half or three for the ambiance. It's a crowded little place, and we were seated in the far back - an area that was likely an outdoor space previously and felt like it (we kept our coats on as it was super cold). The food came super speedily; there was no space between the apps and the entrees. The fried tofu was very tasty, as was the celltuce salad. Less successful were the 886 noodles. The flavor resembled sesame noodles and had a strong peanuty flavor and viscous texture. They were also super oily. We preferred the beef noodle soup but, overall, felt that the apps were more successful flavor-wise.

Make sure to book your reservation in advance! They release 2 weeks ahead. From the outside, it's a bit easy to miss - not very well marked or bright colors and once you go inside it's on the smaller side; tiny but cozy. The kitchen seems to be downstairs and the seating is right next to the bar area. The bathrooms are fun though, it's like disco themed. I opted to skip the BDSM chicken (if you want to try it make sure to come at 5pm since they only make 5 for the day) and instead tried their braised fish stuffed with fish cake. That was the best thing in my opinion; I also tried the you fan with bacon, pea shoots with tofu skin, and 886 noodle. They were all good but pretty salty. The tables are also kind of tightly packed next to one another. I would say worth a try if you're around the area, but maybe not if it's a far trek.

This was such a cute spot for dinner! We got the Fly's Head with Lettuce Cups and BDSM chicken, which were the perfect amount to share! The fried tangyuan was such a medley of flavors and textures but unexpectedly delicious - who knew that cilantro would go so well with desert! Service was great, and the ambiance and decor was so cute (the bathroom is an experience haha).
I was excited to try this place for their ice cream. But after waiting a half hour after ordering I was brought fried tangyuan soaking in half melted ice cream. Sent it back.
Cute Taiwanese spot in Brooklyn. Service was great from the host to the server. Flavors were fragrant and plentiful. Drinks were strong. Definitely recommend

Everything was amazing except I was not aware there's a separate menu for brunch and dinner. I was very excited for the whole BDSM chicken and You Fan with uni, which were only offered for dinner. Nonetheless, my friends and I still had a great time and the food was delicious. We ordered the BDSM chicken sandwich, which was juicy and flavorful. The cocktails were strong and not too sweet. The waitress was friendly and was helpful with making our dinner reservation so we could try the dinner menu.

Incredible food and great service. The waiter we had was very nice and friendly. For bites we got the popcorn chicken and that was made very well. The crispness of the chicken was great and the sweet sauce it had went well. We also got the cold noodles, chicken sandwich, egg tater tots, pea shoots, and pork rice dish. All of them were super flavorful and great! We also had the sweet toast for dessert and that was very good. The toast was crispy on the outside while warm and soft on the inside. The flavors were amazing. Definitely come here for some good food!
Too expensive.  Food is not fresh.  They were pre-made. I will not go back.  The chicken was too try and too expensive.

A modern take on Taiwanese cuisine with a bar area  and great aesthetics. The popcorn chicken and the Lo Ba Beng is amazing! Super crispy with a splash of honey on the chicken. The rice dish is a classic with tons of flavor and the pork is out of the world! Price is on the higher end but worth the flavor of the food!

We came at brunch time so missed out on some of the popular dishes but if you want a smaller version of BDSM chicken. They do have a sandwich with it at brunch time. I thought it was perfectly cooked and juicy. We also go the tator tot wrap which was good but honestly I wish it was more Asian flavors vs being a an American fusion. Overall a good time but wish I could have tried the tang yuan dessert which they did not have a brunch

Delicious Taiwanese food served with cool vibes. I love ordering whole fish at restaurants and the steamed fish is among the crème de la crème of whole fish dishes in the city. Also highly recommend the cold sesame noodles, one of those seemingly easy dishes that's on every Chinese restaurant menu but takes skill to pull off just right (and the one served here is just right). Definitely order drinks when you're here too. They have a great selection of cocktails that will particularly appeal to adventurous drinkers.

Wenwen, much like it's sister restaurant 886, was a solid spot overall. Definitely a fun and lively atmosphere inside, with everyone as much into the food as they were the conversations happening around it. Didn't have any drinks this time around but they had several tasty looking cocktails (and mocktails too!). The winner for me was the cold sesame noodles. I could've devoured them all, if only I had a fork. The pea shoots with tofu skin were a tasty veggie dish, and the shrimp floss was certainly an interesting try. I thought the lettuce served with the shrimp floss should have been something more cup-like to better hold the dishes' contents, but we made do. There was much more to try on the menu than we had room for, so I wouldn't hesitate to come back and try the BDSM chicken or the soup-less Taiwanese beef noodles if I were in the area.

We visited around 9:30 on a Wednesday night and were told that we would have to wait for 15 minutes...but after waiting, we were seated at a table that was already available when we first walked in. While there are peanut-free options, it isn't particularly friendly for those with peanut allergies. We didn't get to order the BDSM chicken, which is supposed to be the most popular and limited item on the menu. The shrimp floss lettuce cup might be the only thing we ordered that I would want to eat again. I loved the crunch of the youtiao and it was a unique spin on the lettuce wraps I've had in the past. Listed in order of what I liked most to least, we also got the pork belly and cuttlefish, 886 noodles, and crispy fried tofu. I was super bummed that I couldn't try the fried tangyuan due to the allergy, but at least it saved me $16.

Underwhelming and mediocre food. 886 in east village is much better. The noodles were alright and the shrimp lettuce wraps were quite disappointing. The fried chicken appetizer was juicy though, but the fried tangyuan with ice cream saved the dinner. Ambiance was a little odd but was a full house on a Sunday night. Would not recommend overall, especially since it is a little hard to get to in Greenpoint.

Let me start off by saying how hard it is to snag a reservation here, I had to book one month advance and drumroll.... It was pretty good! My fave dishes were the fried tangyuan, it was a super unique take on a classic Chinese dish that I grew up eating, and the fried popcorn chicken. I give it 4 stars because while Wenwen puts a fun spin on classic Taiwanese dishes, I almost prefer the classic dishes without all the pizzazz! Some of the flavors were too overpowering like the pork belly with rice. Regardless, the service was fantastic & a great spot to catch up with friends over dinner at a trendy casual spot with drinks. They have sake on tap! (Also - really cool bathroom lol)

I wouldn't say Wenwen is authentic Taiwanese, but they do have some interesting fusion dishes. Didn't have a chance to try the BDSM chicken, but was able to try a few others that the server recommended. Prices are higher than the quality of the food, but there aren't many options in the area.

Must go location. My partner is gluten sensitive so we ordered Lo Ba Beng, Numbing Celtuce Salad, Crispy Fried Tofu W/Garlic Soy Paste and Fried Tangyuan W/ Ice Cream (these menus should contain gluten but less)- it took me back to Taiwan.. except for the numbing Celtics salad, which was a common numbing taste(still good, just not unique in my point of view). It was SO GOOD. I cannot wait to visit again to try the beef noodles and chicken...

Okay, it's true, Wen Wen is worth the hype. I was lucky enough to snag a reservation about a month ago and wow, I see why it's so popular. We started with the celtuce salad, which was lip-tingly, garlicky, and unassumingly incredible. Next came the hot honey popcorn chicken, which might just have been my favorite dish with the right amount of sweet and spicy. We shared two entrees, the three-cup chicken, which was... perfect, and the cold sesame noodles (skip these, they're fine but lack any standout flavor). The black sesame mochi dessert was mindblowing, with a completely unique combination of flavors. I'm also super appreciative to our lovely server, who gave us shots and guava juice for the road. Moral of the story - Wenwen can't be missed!

Disappointed - will I come back again after tonight ? hell No!!  Couple of the signature dishes is just over priced and the flavor is very blend. When I complaint about a dish and the waiter just didn't try to improve or anything

This place is super popular right now so either get there right at open and be prepared for a wait, or book a reservation FAR in advance! We got lucky and were first in line and were able to sit at the bar. The BDSM chicken is the most popular dish and comes in VERY limited quantities; they were already sold out and again, we were there right at open! Every item was delicious and came out freshly made, so all the fried items were perfectly crispy and piping hot. Highly recommend the seaweed fries ($10); hands down the best fries I've ever had. The popcorn chicken ($13), huadiao shrimp ($23), sesame noodles ($15), and three cup chicken ($18) were all amazing. Definitely come with friends so you can share!

Had a great dinner with a friend here and I didn't realize how popular their chicken dish was that they only made a limited amount like 5 a day and so we didn't get a chance to try it but we tried a lot of other wonderful dishes. I particularly liked their popcorn chicken (I'm a big fan of Taiwanese fried chicken) and their nori fries SO GOOD!! Their fried rice hits home for me but the pork on top wasn't my favorite so I think I'll forgo it next time. We also really enjoyed their pickled cucumbers too.

I was skeptical going in because I grew to not enjoy 886 that much and knew the same owner opened Wenwen. However, I was really happy with the food both times I dined. The second time we were lucky enough to get one of the orders of the bdsm fried chicken (they only sell a few per day so I'd say it's worth trying if the opportunity presents itself) and it was delightful. I am not a huge fan of beef noodle soup and am very particular about the taste (the best ones I've had are still from hole in the wall places in Taiwan), but really like the one here! Pass on the you-fan - I prefer mine authentic and the spices they use do not do this dish any favors. The fish is a no brainer - the flavor is phenomenal and my favorite part is they debone it for you! If you want to order a vegetable to balance our the meal I suggest getting the water spinach. I also enjoyed the crispy tofu - the garlic sauce they give is tasty. I don't remember the cocktails I ordered but they were also good and it's exciting that this place serves alcohol because that was a missing element to 886. The downstairs seating area is definitely not as nice, but it didn't impact the service. Our server was very attentive and it never felt like we couldn't find her.

A cool, buzzy restaurant with some real gems on the menu. I would go back any day for the popcorn chicken and the celtuce salad. The beef noodle soup was a pretty great rendition and though I thought the broth could've had more flavor, as a whole it made for a pretty delicious bite. I was lucky enough (aka got in line at 4:30) to have the BDSM chicken and while it's kind of a fun spectacle, as well as a very juicy fried chicken, I would take the popcorn chicken over it any day. The tang yuan dessert was a nice touch. Don't forget to check out the bathroom - a complete vibe!

Glad to finally try this place, highly recommended by some friends. Reservations are a must, they are always packed and hard to find any seats for walk ins. I must say their pork fried rice is one of the best I've had on the east coast. Their water spinach was also tasty and their popcorn chicken. Overall a great place to have some tasty food with a group of friends!

Everything we ordered was great, I've never tried modern Taiwanese before, and it did not disappoint. Cocktails were good too. Walked in without a reservation so we put our name down for what they said would be about an hour wait, so I walked down to a place called Esme down the street. Had a few drinks there and after about 30 minutes they called us with the table ready.

Excellent Taiwanese restaurant with relaxed vibes.  The popcorn chicken was great and almost a meal on to itself.  The shrimp floss lettuce was really good--basically lettuce wraps.  Would've given 5 stars but their drink menu needs  serious intervention.  Not one good drink.

EVERYONE COME HERE. Showed up for a 5PM reservation, right when they opened. There was already a line to get in and i'm pretty sure all of these people had reservations. We were pregaming for a friend from out of town, running the NYC Half. I guess they call this carbo-loading. We ordered pretty much everything. Three cup chicken, crispy fried tofu, fly's head, lo ba beng, lily fleming fried rice, whole striped bass, and youfan with uni. After our amazing meal, we HAD to give our best to Eric and Andy. They were super nice guys and stuck around to chat for a bit. I need to get out to 886 in EV and come back to Wenwen for another unforgettable meal.

Not sure if I would have given Wenwen two stars in the New York Times, but the food is here is good.  No dumplings which are a major part of Taiwanese restaurant cooking.  The Sacha Hot Honey Popcorn Chicken and the Crispy Fried Tofu were quite good.  Less successful was the Numbing Celtruce Salad.  All fall under the section of Small Bites, though the dishes are not small. They are large appetizers.   We also liked the Shrimp Floss Lettuce cup and the Lily Flemming Fried Rice.  The peanut desert was tasty.  Service was good.  Plates come out at the speed of sound -- not sure how the kitchen does it. This is a small restaurant so booking in advance is essential.
Beef noodle soup hits the spot.  Ingredients all on point and come together perfectly.  Much needed addition to the neighborhood.

not worth the hype. popcorn chicken is good as were the pea shoots with tofu skin. enough to bring me back here? not really, when it's nothing so special about the establishment that i couldn't get something similar in chinatown or other taiwanese restaurants
I think it's just not bad. Slightly over hyped but definitely not bad. I think Bonnie's is better but this is a good place to go if you can't get in.

Food was average. Overrated. OVERPRICED. Drinks were comically bad. If you get there and they're sold out of the BDSM chicken, don't worry. It's annoying to eat, messy, and... fine. I ended up paying way too much for a passable, vaguely spicy fried chicken. The space is pretty in a very basic way. Service veered between spacey to rude. The staff we encountered all seemed as if they'd rather be anywhere else. There are far better places nearby with kinder, more informed staff, better drinks, and better food.

Omg. Chefs kiss. To all things. Drinks were delicious, bathroom is impeccable, and the food was better than I could have imagined! We went after 8pm and the bdsm chix was sold out, so got the popcorn chicken and was a great substitute! Loved the beef broth soup and noodles , and the fried tofu was also unreal. The dessert was also delightful!

The food is incredible, I wasn't able to get the BDSM chicken this time but I highly recommend it as well. (Tip: Arriving at opening time as they only sell 5 BDSM chickens per day.) Highly recommend the Beef Noodle Soup and the Popcorn chicken. The drinks were excellent as well and came very quickly. Only con for the night, the host sat a party of the same size before my table even though we had arrived first.

100% a must try place but not necessarily a place i need to come to like once a week. Pretty normal interior and the food is an 8/10. I highly recommend coming and trying this place the staff is very friendly and they have pretty cool drinks too.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: This place totally lived up to the hype. The food was completely unreal and the service was impeccable. Everything was delicious but the Shrimp Floss Lettuce cups were the true ringer. It had no right being that good. I'm going to try to come back here as often as they'll let me.

The BDSM chicken is one of the best fried chicken I've ever had in my life. Basically an orgasm in your mouth. They call it BDSM for a reason  Sweet, salty, a little bit of spice, super crunchy, and oh my my, moist . YouFan is also a must. The uni addon makes such a difference. Their cocktails are strong and delicious. What a thought-out menu! Chef Sze definitely didn't disappoint!! They only sell 5 chickens per night. We came at 5, right when they opened and ours was the last one. So if you really want to feel that orgasm in your mouth, you better get there early

Food was pretty good, maybe a bit on the pricier side. The bad review is coming from the service which was pretty good until the end where we kept getting rushed and unfinished food that my mother was still eating was tossed out while she went to the toilet.
Was great. I wouldn't travel for it if I didn't live near by. K pop bathrooms are awesome.

Wenwen is one of the best restaurants I've ever been to, of any cuisine.  We ordered a lot of classic dishes and they were executed to perfection.  The chicken pot and pork cutlet (with the fried rice) were unbelievably tender, I have no idea how they made them so soft.  My only regret is that I wasn't able to come here again while I was in town.  The people at the restaurant were also awesome and friendly.  Have I said enough yet, I love this place.

They know what's up. I've been to Taiwan and grew ip on LuRouFan, their version is better. The BDSM chicken blew my mind. I thought there was complex umami but didn't know what it came from till I watched the recipe on Munchies: fermented bean curd （腐乳）. It's soooo good. Dare I say, better than southern style

Everything was absolutely amazing. From the restaurant ambiance to the food. Everything is a must have! We got the numbing celtuce salad, shrimp floss lettuce cup, water spinach & shrimp paste, Lily Flemming fried rice with fried pork jowl, whole BDSM (brined deboned soy milk) fried chicken, and fried tangyuan with ice cream. The fried tangyuan with ice cream reminded me of a night market snack with peanuts and cilantro. We also got The Boiling Point and Jungle Negroni. Recommend the Boiling Point for a light drink.

Absolutely phenomenal new restaurant in greenpoint! Definitely worth a visit - you won't be disappointed! The interior is very beautiful and the food is wonderful - definitely get the fried chicken and the fried tangyuan for dessert!

Very nice decor when you walk in. Promptly seated and led to a nice downstairs area. Everything on the menu looks good but we came too late so couldn't get the BDSM chicken (pro tip: show up at 5). Food was amazing and chef super and came out to say hi. Gave us another chicken dish on the house! 10/10 would recommend.

I appreciate the authenticity and the food that does not try to adapt itself  to Western taste, but man, it was a tough experience for me. The flavors were hard, my mouth became paralyzed, it was like eating perfume.
Cannonballing into the scene! Amazing dinner. From the cocktails to the food (oh the food!) everything was on point. Great addition to Greenpoint. Will absolutely be coming back for more!!
Nice little spot but much of the food is not fresh. The shrimp is actually frozen. The dish was mushy and little flavor.  Was hoping this would be a regular spot for our group.
Best Japanese curry in my opinion, they are consistent and quick. If you want a good meal, I would definitely recommend this chain restaurant.

Came here for chicken katsu curry. The sauce was delicious and sweet. The tempura and sausage adds additional flavour. The chicken is fragile and crispy. Recommend to eat slowly. Overall, the meal is fulfilling as one whole meal.

Great spot for a quick and delicious bite to eat. I love their katsu, enjoy their sauce, and always have a hard time deciding which of the many add-ons/options I want to enjoy. If you're hungry and in the area, stop by. And if you're hungry and not in the area, travel to a Go! Go! Curry! near you.

Food was tasty. I felt like the portions were fair for the price. Ill be honest and say it was good the best Japanese curry out there but was definitely good for fast food. Service was good. Nice staff. This location has a small dining area.

Great portion for the price. Curry dish we got was really good. The rice was well done. the fried Chicken meat slices were deliciously cooked. The curry was flavorful and wasnt too spicy at all. The space is small so order quickly. If you like Japanese Curry and youre in the area, try this place out
Super good.  Nothin fancy but worth to try . Dont miss this place near  Brooklyn bridge

Hey guys I will tell you about this place this is very nice wonderful please I have good experience about this this make me happy there is a family environment friendly environment all the employee for friendly and honest recommended all new user for this place ok thanks

Big portions and convenient! The shop is small but the selection is great. The portions are also very generous and lasts me 2 meals! The ration of curry to rice is also very good. My favorite is the chicken curry. I came in here on a rainy day after a long day out and just wanted something hot and filling. This place did not disappoint. It have decent katsu and the toppings are great

What can I say...Go Go Curry has always been my go-to spot for comfort food over the past several years.  There's no better pick-me-up after a long day than inhaling a Home Run Curry.  It comes with a nice mix of katsu, shrimp tempura, sausage and egg to satisfy all of those cravings.  The wings are slightly dry but extremely crispy and the sauce is delectable.  Prices have definitely increased and portion sizes decreased over the past few years but Go Go Curry still remains one of my favorite spots in NYC for some quick, satisfying comfort food!
Ordered takeout and was disappointed with the food, the curry is on the sweeter side and the pork was very dry.

Got go go curry recently. I ordered the Sausage curry. It's a dish of rice cabbage curry and sausage. It wasn't as great as the go go curry I had ordered from years before. I also only got 3 sausages which is the standard serving size but I think is a bit too little. The curry in its own right was good and I like the new packaging for the to-go order.

Great place to grab lunch. I've tried pretty much everything on the menu at this point and everything is good. If you're hungry or indecisive, I'd go with the homerun curry, which gives you a little bit of everything. Vegetarians also need not fear - there's a tofu katsu and veggie tempura option, but just remember to ask for the vegetarian curry sauce as well (I think their default curry has pork in it). The only issue I run into sometimes is that service can be a bit slow. They seem to be short staffed frequently, often with one guy acting as both cook and cashier, so I've had to wait as long as 20 minutes for take out. Not the end of the world, and the food is ultimately worth it when you get it.

a big ol gorilla size bowl of japanese curry that warms the heart and soul.  on the bottom is a bed of rice.  then you pick your size and your protein.  they have small medium large and xlarge and they measure it by weight.  proteins are chicken or pork katsu, tempura by the piece, shrimp, egg, sausage.  then comes the curry and the cabbage.  they also have some combos where you can try many diff proteins.  the grand slam is a popular one where you can a sample of each.  it can get slow since only one person is working.  its a small place so too many cooks will just be more burdensome than help.  when i crave a quick curry, i come here.  its always consistent and theres multiple locations for wherever you are.

Outstanding Japanese curry comfort food.  Fast service, and the counter woman was mega-efficient and friendly.  There's gotta be a reason for that weird gorilla mascot they've got, but ignore that and just get the katsu and you won't think about that gorilla anymore.  Japanese comfort places aren't as abundant as they should be and so glad I found this place.  Dropping the prices slightly would make it five stars.

Love this quick eats and fast affordable place. Perfect for when youre on the go or even want to have a meal! TThe portions are huge as well as the quality isnt poor! Its flavorful with the loads of curry they ply on. Really love the chicken as the crust was so crispy but the inside so moist. As a college student I appreciate how its so cheap as well as quality is still great! Perfect for cheap eatsand speedy service.

THE PHOTO IS A LIE!!! They changed their containers and the portions are less than half of what it used to be! I used to enjoy their curry, but to get a child size serving for $50 is just ridiculous. Maybe they think we're stupid and willing to pay $50 for mostly shredded cabbage and a small bite of rice. They're being cheap cutting corners and it shows. I was even part of their genki rewards but clearly that's useless now. Disappointed and no longer a customer. I refuse to support a business that's openly ripping off their loyal customers.
No. Just go next door to get food. The pork katsu was bland and the whole bowl of curry/veggies/rice that came with it were a little bland. Just not that satisfying.
Wow this place was great. Wanted to try some Chinatown food and this really hit the spot. Would highly recommend the chicken tonkatsu, comes with cabbage and rice.

I ordered a small pork katsu for lunch and it was delicious! Small means the serving of rice weighs 4 oz. For me, it was just the right amount with the pork cutlet and free cabbage. The sauce was a bit spicy but nothing a medium spice person can't handle. I did ask for extra cabbage to balance out the carbs and they were happy to accommodate. Service is quick but if you're looking to dine in, then definitely try to beat the lunch crowd or have a friend grab seats while you place orders. Overall, not a bad lunch option for the area.

This spot actually has some great curry with plenty of fried options available. The service is really quick and the portions are super filling. I went for the small curry but there was actually a good amount of rice. I added shrimp, pork katsu, chicken katsu and fish katsu on top. The katsu were all pretty thin pieces of meat. The fish in particular was really thin. I preferred the pork and chicken over the fish, which really isn't worth it. The shrimp was also pretty small but covered in plenty of breading. Everything was nice and crispy and the curry was really good too. It wasn't spicy at all. I wish there was just a bit more curry sauce though. I also added pickled radish which is a bit sweet and sour and gave a nice flavor contrast to all the fried items. The cabbage that is provided is also a nice refreshing touch. Definitely an affordable, filling, tasty meal!

I ordered the small with chicken katsu and extra cabbage. If you like spicy, definitely drizzle some on top of the cutlet and you have an amazing lunch for around $10, which is almost unheard of in FiDi.
